result.execSummary:
The defendant Jerry Ray Richardson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs, fees and surcharges by 01/09/18 or civil judgment.
Concurrent with: With any other sentence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jerry Ray Richardson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Exhibits received and inventoried this date.  
Box 661
cf

Defendant Jerry Ray Richardson in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Defendant Jerry Ray Richardson in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Parties have reached a resolution and proceed with plea and sentencing.
  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    Defendant ordered to serve 6 months in the House of Correction concurrent to any other sentence with credit of 71 days time served. 
Defendant to pay all costs, fees and surcharges by 1-09-2018 or civil judgment.

filed: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
ORDER TO PRODUCE, THURSDAY JULY 09, 2015 AT 1:30 P.M. IN BR 45, CH RM 515.  kl

Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait in court, defendant Jerry Ray Richardson not in court, in custody.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for continued court trial.  Defendant not produced and Judge Malmstadt not in court today.  Defense motion to dismiss, argued, and denied by the Court. Case needs to be scheduled on a day when Judge Malmstadt is here.  Case passed to 1:30 pm.

Back on the record at 3:07:53, same appearances. Court orders case adjourned for Further Proceedings in Branch 45.

Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait in court.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant not in court.  Discussions held as to how to proceed.  Court orders case adjourned for continued Court Trial.  Court trial scheduled for June 9, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Court ordered bond modified to a $250.00 signature bond with a Turnover to JusticePont for modification.  Court only wants JusticePoint to test for drugs other than THC, and Alcohol.  Court will not accept any violations regarding THC or Alcohol.  jks  Court trial scheduled for 05-01-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jerry Ray Richardson in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Defendant Jerry Ray Richardson in custody.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court Trial Proceed.  Sworn for the state:  Shaun Klimek.  State's exhibits #1, #2, & #3 offered and received in to evidence.   There is trouble with the tape.  It may not be showing us all of the footage.  Court ordered court trial adjourned to allow state time to get full footage to be able to be seen this the court room.   Case adjourned for Court Trial in Branch 46.  Defense objects to adjournment.  Because Court has decided this case will remain on for trial, Defense requests that bond be modified to a signature bond.  jks

Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait in court, defendant Jerry Ray Richardson not in court, in custody, not produced.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. .  Case remains in trial posture.  Case remains scheduled for trial on 3-9-2015 at 8:30 a.m. in Branch 46. jks

Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait in court, via telephone, defendant Jerry Ray Richardson not in court, in custody.  Defense counsel is ill and unable to appear. Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered case adjourned for final pre-trial conference in Branch 46. jks
  Final pre-trial scheduled for 02-23-2015 at 01:30 pm.
MOTION FOR REDUCTION OF BAIL, filed.  Case to be heard on 2-20-2015 at 8:30 a.m. for final pretrial in Branch 46. jks

Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait in court, defendant Jerry Ray Richardson not in court, in custody, Not produced.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense motion to modify bail is DENIED by the Court.   Speedy trial demand made.  Court ordered case adjourned for final pretial and jury trial in Branch 46. jks
  Jury trial scheduled for 03-09-2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with SAKS OFF 5TH, 11500 W BURLEIGH ST., WAUWATOSA.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jerry Ray Richardson in court with attorney Mark A. Dluzak.  Defendant Jerry Ray Richardson in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Branch 46.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for January 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
